Description: La Fête dans le harem, one of four studies for Plate 112 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; interior with seated man, a woman reclining on his lap, and young women dancing and playing music, celebrating a feast or holiday Pen and grey ink and brown wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by the artist. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum. See also 1836,0109.181.a See also 1836,0109.181.b See also 1836,0109.180.b
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
